issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h5. Problem description
There might be some scenarios when Alloy is not able to compile for some user error - see sample. 

These error messages are not being transmitted to studio

h5. Steps to reproduce
1. Run the sample code reported here (notice the <All> tag instead of <Alloy> at the beginning)

h6. index.xml
{code}
<All>
	<Window class="container">
		<Button>Create User</Button>
	</Window>
</Alloy>
{code}
2. Run the code processor
Result: 'Code processor has encountered a problem. No output received.' error popup message is displayed.
3. Click on the 'details'.
Result: 'No output received' error message is displayed again and duplicated. 

The alloy error messages should be displayed in studio
fields.summary: Code Processor: Error messages from alloy recompile are not being displayed in studio
fields.environment:
Titanium SDK 3.1.1.v20130611153550
Appcelerator Studio 3.1.1.201306101955
Code Processor 1.0.1-cr4
Alloy 1.1.3-cr
Node 0.8.22

comments.body:
This issue was previously scheduled to be worked on in more than one sprint:
* 'Release 3.1.2' (on board '3.1.X Triage')
* 'Release 3.0.1/TS 3.0.2' (on board '3.1.0 Triage')
* 'Release 3.3.0' (on board '3.2.X Triage')

Starting from JIRA Agile 6.3, an issue can only belong to a single future sprint. Read more about this change: http://docs.atlassian.com/agile/docs-0630/Sprint+Marker+Migration

This issue is now scheduled for future sprint 'Release 3.1.2' (on board '3.1.X Triage').

If this is incorrect, please update the issue accordingly.

This comment was automatically generated by JIRA. If it is no longer relevant, please feel free to delete it.
Closing ticket as Code processor is no longer supported.
